# AVInputPickerInteraction.Delegate

**Protocol**

The `AVInputPickerInteractionDelegate` protocol defines methods you use to receive notifications about transitions in an `AVInputPickerInteraction` object.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol Delegate : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Responding to life cycle events

- **inputPickerInteractionWillBeginPresenting(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the input picker view is about to present devices.
- **inputPickerInteractionDidEndPresenting(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the input picker view has finished presenting devices
- **inputPickerInteractionWillBeginDismissing(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the input picker view is about to dismiss devices.
- **inputPickerInteractionDidEndDismissing(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the input picker view has finished dismissing devices.

## Setting the delegate

- **delegate**: The input picker view’s delegate.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

items.description: Tells the delegate that the input picker view is about to present devices.
items.name: inputPickerInteractionWillBeginPresenting(_:)

items.description: Tells the delegate that the input picker view has finished presenting devices
items.name: inputPickerInteractionDidEndPresenting(_:)

items.description: Tells the delegate that the input picker view is about to dismiss devices.
items.name: inputPickerInteractionWillBeginDismissing(_:)

items.description: Tells the delegate that the input picker view has finished dismissing devices.
items.name: inputPickerInteractionDidEndDismissing(_:)
